intro: Dactylicapnos arunachalensis, commonly known as the Arunachal bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of India. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with a fine pubescence, while its stems are erect and often branched. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
